verbs.description: browbeat (third-person singular simple present browbeats, present participle browbeating, simple past browbeat, past participle browbeaten)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To bully in an intimidating, bossy, or supercilious way.
examples: Synonyms: bully, cow, domineer, intimidate; see also Thesaurus:intimidate
Though the teacher browbeat all the children, they still acted out during the lesson.
